meanings.definition: To discharge or emit moisture, liquid, or smell gradually
meanings.sent1: The flower seemed to exude a sweet fragrance all day.
meanings.sent2: The wet towel started to exude water after being squeezed.
meanings.sent3: The leaky faucet continued to exude droplets, creating a tiny puddle.
meanings.sent4: The damp soil exuded a musty smell after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The fresh bread exuded a tempting aroma throughout the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To exhibit a particular quality or feeling prominently
meanings.sent1: Her confidence seemed to exude from every gesture she made.
meanings.sent2: The painting exuded a sense of tranquility and peace.
meanings.sent3: The enthusiastic puppy exuded joy with every wag of its tail.
meanings.sent4: The leader exuded authority and command in every decision.
meanings.sent5: The cozy room exuded warmth and comfort, making everyone feel at home.

meanings.definition: To display an emotion or quality strongly and openly
meanings.sent1: She exuded kindness in every interaction with others.
meanings.sent2: The actor exuded passion in every scene of the play.
meanings.sent3: The chef exuded creativity in every dish he prepared.
meanings.sent4: The singer exuded emotion in every note she sang.
meanings.sent5: The athlete exuded determination and perseverance in every competition.
